page.title: 14ARMY
page.content: {Hereford}is well known for being the home of the{Special Air Service regiment but not so many people know about the{"Depot",}as it is called, at {Pontrilas.}The camp was built during the{last war}as a storage depot for {munitions}but now it is mainly used as a{training area.}A lot of what goes on behind the high barbed-wire fence is secret but{explosions}and{gunfire frequently echo across the valley and {helicopters}and{parachutists}are often seen. The road passes right through the camp and you can see derelict buildings and an airliner fuselage that are used for training. Part of the camp is used as a{radio {transmitting}and{receiving}station. The{surrender}message from the {Falkland Islands}was received there.
